document_name: PRODOC HR Access to Justice and Anti Corruption - final version 270209.pdf
http://www.undp.org/content/dam/undp/documents/projects/SUR/00057091/PRODOC HR Access to Justice and Anti Corruption - final version 270209.pdf

outputs.output_descr: The Government of Suriname lays heavy emphasis on the protection and promotion of human rights. Suriname has signed and acceded to most of the important international and regional human rights treaties and declarations. The project aims to build capacity of government and non government actors to meet treaty obligations, draft/implement policy amd raise awareness on human rights issues more broadly.  Under the project training sessions will be done for government and non government actors and assistance will be provided to the government in reporting on Human Rights obligations.

This project will support strengthening of the legal aid system, public education and awareness, as well as enhance proper monitoring and managing processes towards improving the mechanisms for protecting and promoting the human rights of the citizens of Suriname.

This Project will support the Government's efforts to prevent, detect and manage corruption through enhanced understanding of corruption and the fundamental institutions and transparency and accountability measures needed for the prevention and management of corruption.
Adequate human resource capacity and coordination mechanisms for efficient management and timely implementation of activities under the full project (Human Rights, Legal Access and Anti Corruption)

project_descr: Support for Implementing the Policy Plan for Legal Protection and Human Rights, and Anti-Corruption
